p: The stigma related to some of the most common infectious pathologies (in the past and in the current century), such as human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), hepatitis C virus (HCV), tuberculosis, and Zika, is present at all levels, and acts as a critical barrier for effectively addressing it. This may also influence the treatment uptake, and under- or non-participation in treatment available [ 30], in particular in those countries where access to care is still affected by the effects of the global economic crisis of the past decade [ 53].
